input: Watch the fur fly as a new breed of superhero is born in Disneys fun-filled epic adventure. An ordinary day at Fernfield Farms turns extraordinary when Budderball, Mudbud, B- Dawg, Buddha and Rosebud discover mysterious rings that grant them each a unique superpower. Before you can say,deg;Buddies, assemble; the pups unleash their amazing abilities and race to the rescue when a shape-shifting bully from outer space threatens the planet.
label: family

input: Brendan, Wheels and Justine are your typical tweens. But as if the usual school pressure wasn't enough, these three kids all share one huge secret - they're all actually part of a secret organization of super tween spies, or as we know them, the Extreme Team.
label: family

input: What could be more inviting than checking out a new locale and jumping into a new scene? Especially when experienced through the eyes of a smart, saucy, and blooming young girl named YaYa. YaYa's Wonderful World takes kids on an informational and entertaining jaunt enlightening us all with a fresh angle on cool crowds, jumping joints, and fabulous fare.
label: family

input: In a final desperate attempt to protect her family's hardware store business from eminent domain, Grace Hightower enters the fight of her life risking everything she and her family have ever stood for as she goes toe-to-toe with the Mayor of Greendale.
label: family

input: Host Heidi Klum throws a temper tantrum when an 8-year-old tells her she's off the "best dressed" list, Bijan shares his money-making secrets, Heidi gets comedy material from the kids at the children's hospital and never before seen footage from SFK.
label: family

input: Selma learns that her family will be evicted from their house. Heartbroken she flees out into the winter night. She takes protection against the snow storm in a gigantic building that proves to be the Academy of Science. There Ephraim von Trippelhatt presents his latest studies. Trippelhatt has discovered that Santa Claus is not only a mythological being, but real.
label: family

input: Ramesh and Malti have made it big in their life after lot of struggle their only son Samir a college student has never struggled in life for anything.Samir wants to live life like a free bird and doesn't want his parents to interfere in his life as he feels his parents also did the same in their younger age.Ramesh and Malti scold him and tell him that they did party in their times but they were responsible towards their duties.Later due to his way of lifestyle Samir is caught in drug raid.
label: family

input: Inspired by the heartwarming real life story of an American family. Joy Collins is stricken with a very rare virus, and has brought her to the brink of death. Her doctors are at the ready to save her and she is now waiting for a heart transplant. Her your son Gabe has gathered the family together of pray for her recovery, with the help of the spirit of his late grandfather. A Christmas tale about faith, family and the true meaning of the holiday season.
label: family

input: Liam is a 12 year old with a big problem - himself. He's way too tall for his age and is always mistaken for an adult. Although this is a pain in the butt - because who wants to act like an adult? - there are some good things that come out of it. Like a trip to the moon! Unfortunately, the rocket ship he's on is off course and it's up to him to save the kids on board.
label: family

input: Meet Flukey, a whale who dreams of flying. Artfully crafted and narrated, The Whale Who Could Fly is an animated, uplifting story for young children. With a fun mini game and simple interactive features, young readers will return to it again and again.
label: family

input: Sam Steele Jr. wants to be a detective like his father, so when summer vacation starts he turns his clubhouse into the headquarters for the Junior Detective Agency. When a mysterious burglar known as The Cat rampages through the town, Sam Jr. takes on the case with the help of his friend Emma and her trusty dog. "Jr. Detective Agency" is a fun-filled adventure sure to crack the code to your heart!
label: family

input: Caliph Stork tells the story of two friends, Casper and Pepper, who find a mysterious magical book filled with secrets. With its help they are able to fly on a magic carpet from Germany to a far away kingdom where they unintentionally land in the midst of three evil sorcerers. Before they know it, Casper and Pepper fall under their spell and are transformed into a stork and a frog and are left to fend for themselves in the desert. And this is where their adventure really begins in 3D.
label: family

input: Kids between ten end twelve devided into two teams are camping at Kolmĺrden zoological Park. They compete against each other and experience action packed as well as knowledge based contests, where one of the prizes in every episode will be a new team mate who reinforces the group in time for the final competition and the first prize. We will also take part of the kids every day life in their camp, constructing shelter, cooking over an open fire, home sickness and what they talk about in the evenings.
label: family

input: Where the Fast Lane Ends - Movie, rated Family-Friendly (How rare these days), About a family in Atlanta in the fast lane, losing touch with their kids, get invited to get back to the farm roots, and see how the family changes for the better. Endorsed by the National FFA! You have to see this movie!!
label: family

input: Claire's world is turned upside down when her mother is diagnosed with cancer. Leaving college, Claire puts her dream of becoming a professional dancer aside and takes on two jobs to help with her mother's mounting bills. With the help of her family, new-found friends, and the support of an old flame, Claire struggles to step out of the spotlight, serve others, and truly have the heart of a dancer!
label: family

input: Herbie and Hippy are practicing for a dance contest but get distracted by the kids jumping on the bed. The go out the the yard to show all of their friend their waltz skills. They then find that they misread the flier and had already missed the competition.
label: family

input: A heroic young boy single handedly changes the way pediatric cancer patients are treated when he begins a weekly toy-drive for kids in the hospital that grows into a national movement. A boy's infectious spirit and determination are tested when he is stricken with a rare form of cancer, but with the help of his family and friends he creates a weekly toy-drive for kids in the hospital that becomes a legacy of love that inspires thousands and outlasts his disease.
label: family

input: Jessica has a big presentation in Palm Springs. There are a couple of problems though: her two kids who will do anything to get mom and dad back together again - even if they have to hack mom's phone or pose as a secretary to make sure dad's in Palm Springs too. And father Joe who'll do anything to charm his way back into Jessica's life.
label: family

input: Three princesses-sisters are cursed to dance every night until the dawn. A young handsome lad who starts working in the castle as a gardener's helper falls in love with one of the princesses and decides to set them free from the curse. An old wise lady helps him on the way with a word of wisdom and a bit of magic;-)
label: family

input: This wonderful holiday special tells of two families struggling to survive in the world today. The friendship they forge with each other, the dangers and challenges they face, the animal rescues they accomplish and their renewed faith make this a beautiful Christmas story for families. This has been so well received by productions now in talks, there may be several holiday specials to follow along similar lines.
label: family

input: The broadcast of the 18th annual "A Place Called Sacramento" Film Festival on Access Sacramento cable recorded at the world premiere of the 10 original short films in their theatrical showing in Oct. 2017. Film Festival Director Gary Martin introduces the film series and presents awards on stage.
label: family

input: Get to know your ABCs with the fun-filled adventure that celebrates the wonder of words and the joys of the alphabet Sesame Street style. Shapes, sounds, and colors come to life as letters. A and Z join Elmo and the gang for some F-U-N at the mall.
label: family

input: Nathan Glenmore wants to be a rock star. Unfortunately, he has no talent. He enters a contest at his high school for "America's Next Big Star." The record label executives responsible for the contest choose Nathan as a bet to see if they can turn a "no-talent" teenager into a star. Nathan's life is changed forever, as well as the lives of those involved with the "bet."
label: family

input: A celebration of the first 25 of the popular Canadian children's show "Mr. Dressup". In this show, Mr. Dressup is accidentally sent back in time to the early days of his TV Shows and must return to the present to make a phone call to Casey and Finnigan who are now attending Kindergarden with their creator Judith Lawrence in British Columbia. While his computer phone attempts to contact Casey & Finnigan it manages to pick up birthday messages from several celebrities wishing Mr. Dressup "Happy Birthday"
label: family

input: A Madison Avenue executive, Amy, discovers an unusual Christmas surprise when she inherits her Aunt's hometown bakery. The real surprise comes when she learns the other half of the bakery was left to her long-ago boyfriend, Jack. Unresolved personal issues resurface between them, as the exes return home to co-manage the store, along with its traditional holiday cookie bake-off.
label: family

input: Barney's Super-dee-duper Singing Circus has arrived! And it's got everything children want to see: a marching band, a carful of silly clowns, a flying squirrel on a trapeze, prancing ponies, a lion tamer, whistling wiener-dogs, a strongman that can lift Ringmaster Barney high over his head and more.
label: family

input: A children's musical show that aired on PBS in the mid 80s. The show opened with a theme song about mrs. Cabobble that folded a toy train that ran through the fictional neighborhood she loved in. Mrs. Cabobbles live in a red caboose along with many other character and neighbors. Talking furniture and friends from around her neighborhood helped her teach children about music.
label: family

input: When Ken wanders into the forest out of boredom, he finds himself trapped behind a mystical door to another world. Though it appears it can be unlocked with a puzzle, the door is locked, and the 4 keys needed to open it are scattered across this strange world. Luckily, he gains the trust of a baby sphinx, Ari, who is willing to help him locate the missing keys. However, even with Ari's help, Ken will come to discover that getting them will not be so straightforward....
label: family

input: When Sam Steele Junior gets a term paper assignment on a visit by the Soviet Premier to the Midwest in the late 1950s he's less than enthused. But when he learns it may lead to treasure, the Junior Detective Agency is on the adventure of a lifetime.
label: family

input: Techno Twins follows the adventures of a brilliant young boy and a super-advanced (but socially awkward) droid. Constructed by his father, its sole purpose is to protect him from the nefarious plot of the world's most unsuspected villains. In the end, boy, robot and father become a close-knit "family".
label: family

input: When Barney and his friends go to the beach, the group discovers all sorts of tee-rific things to do! From flying kites to wind-surfing to a trip in a sailboat, join Barney for all sorts of fun-in-the-sun activities. For a dino-mite day, by the ocean or the bay, Let's Go to the Beach with Barney!
label: family

input: Unscripted comedy show that was life broadcast on Saturday afternoons. Retired Secretaty of education, Franz Lafite, hosts an open house afternoon with family members and guests. Lots of cameo appearances and political and cultural references are paired with entertaining misunderstandings.
label: family

input: Writer/Director Corbin Bernsen and Nathan Gamble (The Dark Knight) star in the powerful story about a boy whose search for answers leads him to faith. Oliver is a bright 12-year-old who lives in the shadow of his parents' loss of their first son.
label: family

input: A small town girl has big dreams of becoming an actress/singer in Hollywood. She decides to move to LA to pursue her ambitions, leaving her home town and her boyfriend behind. Once she makes it to LA, she meets a new boy; But can she forget about the love she left behind?
label: family

input: Series of programs made specially for Christmases of 1975 and 1976, half an hour of duration. "Cantar y Reir" it does not have the same structure of "El Gran Circo de TVE". These special programs are emission of Monday through Friday, for the afternoons. In season 1976, the absence of Fofó, died in June of that year is remarkable.
label: family

input: Featuring some of the most beautiful beaches and sounds of waves, Caribbean Lounge relaxing film is ideal for stress relief. The film can be used in a variety of settings: * In private homes to create a personal oasis * In business offices to diffuse stressful situations or encourage creativity * In waiting rooms to reduce anxiety
label: family

input: Vera shows children how to make a paper lantern, reads a story about Busy Lizzie and her 3 wishes, plays with some chicks, reads a story about Jack Tar and talks about mustard and cress. The stories are all acted out by marionette puppets, and Vera is joined by sausage the dog marionette for the other segments.
label: family

input: In this innovative problem solving series, Dot, Dorothy's daughter, goes off to Oz everyday with the children of the beloved characters from L. Frank Baum's classic book, The Wizard of Oz. In each episode, the yellow brick road leads Dot to a new magical location where she solves problems alongside her Oz friends.
label: family

input: A family film which tells the unlikely and timeless story about almost ten year old Tony, whose father rises from being a crane driver to Secretary of State. As a result his parents get divorced and Tony does everything he can to bring them back together. He even calls in the help of the queen.
label: family

input: This show is all about friends and the joy of friendship! Max n' Millie are neighbors and best friends. Max is very active and curious boy who likes to know everything about anything. Millie likes to sing and dance more than anything in the world. Each episode they hit a mystery, but together with Millie's wisdom and patience and Max's creativity they find a solution. In the meanwhile they have lots and lots of fun!
label: family

input: DanTDM Creates a Big Scene follows DanTDM and his group of animated friends as they battle to keep their live show on the road. Each episode catches their behind-the-scenes exploits as they learn skills, overcome challenges and face impossible odds. Alone the way, they find that putting on an epic show isn't as easy as it looks.
label: family

input: A maverick U.S. Fish and Wildlife agent uncovers a global terrorist plot using an international animal trafficking ring to finance a clandestine nuclear weapons program a program destined to permanently shift the balance of power in the Mid-east.
label: family

input: 60 Minutes of non-stop action, Dogs barking, playing and having a ball. All shot from a dogs perspective and set to loop continuously from the time you leave until the time you come home. Quite simply, it's a companion for your best friend while you're away!
label: family

input: An abandoned girl,and a mother abandoning the girl met,what would happen ,will be there a spark for true love .Could this little girl bear the betray of family,the blame from friend .Facing the request of her loved ones ,could her let defense down and embrace the brightness .the vast loess Plateau in China ,and the good and candid people there .this film will explore fundamental humanity! Ugliness or beauty ? You are the judge!
label: family

input: A family decision to follow their father on a boat journey find it has become a most unusual, mysterious adventure. But, the family bonds as never before and a dream is born. This film based on the great Robinson Crusoe will bring love, laughter, tears and hope to audiences. An exceptional director and cast is going to make this a stand-out family film.
label: family

input: Chef Michael Smith invites you into his home kitchen and shows you how to create simple, flavourful meals for your family and friends. Close your cookbooks, look in the fridge, fire your imagination and let your instincts and appetite be your guide!
label: family

input: It's Lucky's first night away from her family and she is a little scared and lonely. That is, until she meets a doggie orphan named Patches and other kennel friends who share their amazing imaginary adventures to astonishing places such as Doggie Paradise!
label: family

input: A new restaurant has just opened up next to Bilige's school, the restaurant's slogan is-''we only catches those wild life animal to put on your plate, we grantee our food is 100% fresh, nature and chemical free!'. until one day, Bilige found an injured eagle trapped in one of the trap that has been set up bu the restaurant owner. Ten years old Bilige realized the cruelty of killing and eating those wild animals, and the battle for the freedom of the wild animals begins from here.
label: family

input: Meet Bookaboo, a world famous rock puppy who tours the globe with his bandmates, Paws and Growler, playing drums to packed stadiums of adoring fans. Just one hitch. Bookaboo can't play without a story a day. Luckily celebrity guests drop backstage on his Bookabus to share their favorite books and coax him back onstage. Read along to illustrated books animated in this story time fun.
label: family

input: The answer is simple - it's a Dish A Day. Belgian cooking is highly regarded the world over, and celebrated in this fresh, daily cooking show in which a personable young chef cooks up delicious, nutritious meals in minutes. Mindful of both the clock and budget, each day sees him preparing super simple, tasty dishes that anyone at home can replicate, bringing a new twist to old classics, or recreating the best of modern cuisine.
label: family

input: Fireman Sam and his team are on a mission to save Pontypandy! When a hurricane threatens the town, emergencies pop up everywhere... from saving the Wildmen of Pontypandy to rescuing a group from the flooding mines to protecting their new fire station. With new recruits, a new station, and a new vehicle, these ultimate heroes are always ready to save the day!
label: family

input: The film is all about Indian classical relationship between a grandson and a grandmother. The first frame opens with the matured grandson comes out of his house and heading to pay homage to his grandmother on her death day. On the way, he remembers the memories of his childhood with his grandmother and expresses how he misses her love and affections.
label: family

input: "In the Beginning" contains two 25-minute episodes. Part 1: "What is the Bible?" How is put together? Kids learn alongside Buck Denver, Sunday School Lady, Brother Louie and the crew that the Bible tells the story of God and what He's done for us. Part 2: "Who wrote the Bible?" Next, Buck and friends learn how God inspired people to write the Bible. They also learn how the first part of Genesis sets the stage for the rest of the Bible - and all of history.
label: family

input: It's one of the greatest collections of aviation action you'll ever see. Exciting entertainment for ages 3 to 93. There's aircraft carrier action, jet demo teams, jet fighters, Warbirds, hot air-show aerobatics, wingwalkers, float planes, jumbo jets, prop planes, ultra-lights, the DC-3, Space Shuttle, Kitty Hawk , the US Air Force Museum and more. Award-winning songs by James Coffey.
label: family

input: A prime time light entertainment game show with comedy sketches for English language education. Hosted by Munmun, contestants take on challenges. Also, 'Kamal's World' with reluctant student Kamal and his English teacher Alex. In series 2 "Raisa in Bangladesh" features Farzana Dua Elahe and Suzana Ansar as they visit their family and business interests around Bangladesh.
label: family

input: The boy by the name of Ural, having argued with the brother, goes on hundred steps to depth of the well-known Bashkir cave. The boys even didn't assume, in what this dispute can pour out! In the ancient world where Ural got, the treacherous Shulgan reigns, who is the brother of Ural-batyr from the Bashkir epos of the same name. Having passed serious tests, Ural comprehends the true price of friendship and fidelity, reveals a secret of rock paintings on walls of an ancient cave.
label: family

input: Une association sans but lucratif enregistrée sous le numéro DX 89330 a pour mission de promouvoir les merveilles de l'électronique. Depuis sa création et sans doute pour longtemps, elle ne compte que trois membres: Alexandre (12 ans), Julie (11 ans), et Isabelle (13 ans). Cette série jeunesse en 6 épisodes passait sur les ondes de Radio-Canada les vendredis soirs ŕ 17h, du 26 novembre 1982 au 31 décembre 1982.
label: family

input: In a village called Kalathur Gramam, located in the small town of Pattukkottai, which in turn is located in the Thanjavur district of Tamil Nadu, lives a pair of father and son. They have been in a dispute with each other, however, for three long decades, starting from the 1970s until the 1990s.
label: family

input: The garden bugs secretly agree to help Buzby show his misbehaving niece and nephew how unpleasant life would be if everyone misbehaved the way they do. After a few encounters with misbehaving bugs-seeing how dangerous, gross, and uncomfortable things can become when no one cleans up after themselves, uses good table manners, or gets enough sleep- Beebee and Buddy decide to practice good behavior.
label: family

input: "His Place" -- "the soap opera set in a diner" -- is a locally-produced, internationally syndicated program videotaped at the studios of WPCB-TV40 in Pittsburgh, PA. Set in a fictional diner (named "His Place"), the camera eavesdrops on unscripted discussions with guests and scripted drama/comedy segments featuring the diner's regular cast, and occasionally features performances by musicians and bands.
label: family

input: A chorusgirl gets a lift from the driver of a millionaire. The Theatre where she works is in financial troubles, and believing she is the fiance of the millionaire the chorusgirl gets her big chance. Only one problem, the millionaire finds out! This film is very like "Happy go lovely" only in a Danish version.
label: family

input: It seems that football is still the most important thing in Koko's life. Zlatko is still spending every second reading books and scolding Koko for being immature. To prove him wrong, Koko tells him that he is in love with a mysterious girl. His love for her is not making him happy. And the girl he is in love with, is just as magical as the heroines in the novels Zlatko reads.
label: family

input: A series of adventures with a little rag doll and her dress-maker owner that transfixed a generation of toddlers in the mid 80's. Or it's a hard hitting documentary on how a 60 odd yr old woman with clear mental health issues takes a ragdoll around with her on picnics and, on occasion, accidentally leaving it in a supermarket freezer...
label: family

input: Christmas is in trouble. Santa, who has been bitten by the Fame Bug, is now magically split from Claus, his conscience and Christmas Spirit. "Fun, fun, fun" seems to be Santa's new purpose in life - which Claus, of course, strongly objects to.
label: family

input: When Luisa, a little 4 year-old girl with autism, is accused of killing her best friend, her older sister, Violeta, decides to investigate on her own to find the truth. Violet, in an effort to help her family and discover what really happened surrounding Toto's death, meets a strange character that will give her not only clues to find the truth but also lead her discover a big secret that her mother kept for a long time and which will change her life forever .
label: family

input: BBC Learning zone presents a nine part series of "Japanese Language & People" that takes an in-depth informative look at the Japanese lifestyle, culture and language. Tokyo reporter Yuka Nukina presents each episode that covers various aspects of cultural issues of both education, business and the country's role in the new age today.
label: family

input: When St. Nicolas allows the ten-year-old girl 'Bloem' to ride on his horse Amerigo they loose his golden horseshoe. Without his magical gem all seems lost for Amerigo as he can no longer walk rooftops. With the celebration of St. Nicolas Eve in serious jeopardy. Together they set out on a epic adventure in finding the source of the golden horse-shoe and it's magic. Will they be able to find it in time? so that St. Nicolas Eve can be celebrated?
label: family

input: Télé-Pirate est une émission de chroniques et de sketches humoristiques. Cette émission jeunesse a permis de découvrir des dizaines de personnages, comme Mario Danger (Christian Bégin), Carrie Adam (Élyse Marquis) et Jean-Sébastien Rogatien-Dutrissac (Guy Jodoin). L'humour était toujours au rendez-vous, et c'est ce qui a rendu l'émission aussi populaire ŕ l'époque.
label: family

input: In this fast paced series, our busy young people Save the Planet one action packed mission at a time through a shared sense of fun, wonder and adventure. Join us as we enter the natural world, exploring and preserving it - and help encourage you to do the same! So if you are passionate about the wonders of creation; want to become more independent in the Great Outdoors or simply enjoy quite interesting facts, be sure to join 'Na Dúlradóiri'!
label: family

input: On the eve of his wedding day, Pastor Jones' soon to be wife develops cold feet when secrets are revealed, and he must reassure her of his affection. Meanwhile the church deacons are concerned about lackluster sermons and the negative impact it is having on church tithes and donations.
label: family

input: The year is 2017, and things are changing fast on the planet Earth. The Outdoor Wild Kids and their Host Mr. Ed. will be exploring these changes as they learn about the planet they live on and those who inhabit it.... past, present and possible futures.
label: family

input: The Costa del Sol, in particular Marbella, is the playground of the rich and famous. Life is lived here like nowhere else in Europe! Private jets, personalized Ferraris, huge ocean going yachts, multi-million Euro mansions, lavish high society parties, fashion & models, bling, and so much more... Join Alan Bond as he 'lives the dream' in the playground of the wealthy, to see what people actually spend their money on.
label: family

input: You are a penguin in a maze of ice-blocks. Slide the blocks to squash the Sno-Bees chasing you or electrocute them by trapping them along a wall. Score 10,000 points for aligning three special diamond blocks. Bonus points are awarded for finishing a level quickly.
label: family

input: Emil's reputation for being a troublemaker makes the Svensson family's neighbours take up a collection for sending the boy off to America. But even if he among other unfortunate mishaps causes his father to get stuck in the outhouse window and get bitten by crawfish, all is forgotten when he skillfully wins the family a free horse. And when Alfred the farmhand gets seriously ill, Emil puts his own life on the line, venturing into a snow storm to get his best friend to a doctor before it is too late.
label: family

input: Great adventures can hatch from the smallest eggs. Fucsia wants to learn to do magic just like her father, and so is pleased as punch when she is allowed to go to witches' school. There, Fucsia learns to make wind and conjures with the clouds. But her magic often has unexpected results, however, as she is sometimes that little bit too ambitious.
label: family

input: We meet Juliette and her soulsie squad Justine Ella and Izzy who are the creative minds behind their website Miss O and Friends created by girls for girls. But problems arise when Juliette's little sister Olivia gets into an argument with Harlie her BFF and Juliette and the soulsie squad encourage the girls to dance it off.
label: family

input: Jeff is a renowned chef and TV personality who thinks he has it all. But when his wife leaves him alone with his young son, Luke, for the weekend, he discovers that he has sacrificed his relationship with his family for professional success and becomes determined to bond with his son. Both Jeff and precocious Luke end up learning valuable life-lessons.
label: family

input: The Williams family has spent numerous years apart because of bitterness and broken relationships. Martha, the oldest of four sibling is tired of the holiday blues so she decides to bring the family together for Christmas. The Williams' family must now come face to face with the ones that hurt them the most. Will Christmas force them to mend their broken hearts and be jolly or will they allow the bitterness of their past to continue the cycle of the "Holiday Blues"?
label: family
